description: Uncertain; but probably from Middle English eddish (found often in compounds: e.g. eddish-hen (“eddish-hen, quail”)), ultimately from Old English edisc (“an eddish or aftermath; pasture; enclosed pasture, park”), equivalent to ed- +‎ -ish.

entries.meaning: An aftergrowth of grass (or other plants) which grows after it has been mowed; also, a field of such growth.
